Class ScannerInput

java.lang.Object
utils.ScannerInput
public class ScannerInput extends Object
This class provides methods for the robust handling of I/O using Scanner. It creates a new Scanner object for each read from the user, thereby eliminating the Scanner bug (where the buffers don't flush correctly after an int read). The methods also parse the numeric data entered to ensure it is correct. If it isn't correct, the user is prompted to enter it again.

  • Method Details

    • readNextInt

      public static int readNextInt(String prompt)
      Read an int from the user. If the entered data isn't actually an int, the user is prompted again to enter the int.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The information printed to the console for the user to read
      Returns:
      The number read from the user and verified as an int.

    • readNextDouble

      Read a double from the user. If the entered data isn't actually a double, the user is prompted again to enter the double.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The information printed to the console for the user to read
      Returns:
      The number read from the user and verified as a double.

    • readNextLine

      public static String readNextLine(String prompt)
      Read a line of text from the user. There is no validation done on the entered data.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The information printed to the console for the user to read
      Returns:
      The String read from the user.
